name: MyV2CreditDelegation
description: comments. This is a proof of concept starter contract, showing how uncollaterised loans are possible using Aave v2 credit delegation. This example supports stable interest rate borrows. It is not production ready (!). User permissions and user accounting of loans should be implemented.

functionDecorators.name: approveBorrower
functionDecorators.description: Approves the borrower to take an uncollaterised loan.

parameterDecorators.name: borrower
parameterDecorators.description: The borrower of the funds (i.e. delgatee).

parameterDecorators.name: amount
parameterDecorators.description: The amount the borrower is allowed to borrow (i.e. their line of credit).

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The asset they are allowed to borrow Add permissions to this call, e.g. only the owner should be able to approve borrowers!.

functionDecorators.name: depositCollateral
functionDecorators.description: Deposits collateral into the Aave, to enable credit delegation This would be called by the delegator.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The asset to be deposited as collateral.

parameterDecorators.name: amount
parameterDecorators.description: The amount to be deposited as collateral.

parameterDecorators.name: isPull
parameterDecorators.description: Whether to pull the funds from the caller, or use funds sent to this contract User must have approved this contract to pull funds if `isPull` = true.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The asset to be repaid User calling this function must have approved this contract with an allowance to transfer the tokens You should keep internal accounting of borrowers, if your contract will have multiple borrowers.

functionDecorators.name: withdrawCollateral
functionDecorators.description: Withdraw all of a collateral as the underlying asset, if no outstanding loans delegated.

parameterDecorators.name: asset
parameterDecorators.description: The underlying asset to withdraw Add permissions to this call, e.g. only the owner should be able to withdraw the collateral!.
